January 30, 2026 — People’s Bank of Commerce is pleased to announce the promotion of Nikki Hoffman to Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer(COO), effective January 1, 2026. Hoffman’s appointment follows the planned retirement of COO Steve Erb, who will retire on March 13, 2026, after an esteemed 40-year career in banking, including 12…

articles.title: Nikki Hoffman promoted to Executive Vice President, Chief Operating Officer at People’s Bank

February 3, 2026 – PBCO Financial Corporation (OTCPK: “PBCO”), the holding company (Company) of People’s Bank of Commerce (Bank), today announced that it has declared a cash dividend of $0.25 per share, approximately 15% of 2025 net income. The $0.25 dividend will be paid on March 5, 2026, to shareholders of record February 18, 2026.…

articles.title: PBCO Announces Cash Dividend

articles.title: Cellars & Gifts in Roseburg Announces Closure After 25 Years

articles.title: “Coffee with Christie” Community Chat Set for Saturday at Winston City Hall

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A multi-agency emergency training exercise simulating a train car hazmat incident is scheduled Feb. 10 in downtown Roseburg. Residents may see emergency vehicles and personnel during the drill. Officials say there is no real emergency and ask the public to avoid the training area if possible.
articles.title: Multi-Jurisdictional Training Exercise Planned for Downtown Roseburg on Feb. 10

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations Feb. 5–6, including theft cases, warrant and parole violation arrests, disorderly conduct, prohibited weapons in parks, and two DUII citations following traffic stops, according to the department’s daily activity logs.
articles.title: Police Log: February 5, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg’s Discover Roseburg 15 geocache series kicks off Saturday, Feb. 7, at the Roseburg Public Library. The free, family-friendly event invites participants to explore the city by hunting for 20 geocaches and earning a limited-edition collector’s geocoin while supplies last.
articles.title: Discover Roseburg 15 Geocache Series kicks off Saturday at the Roseburg Library

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: February 6, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A cold front moving into southern Oregon Sunday night is expected to bring mountain snow into Monday morning. Most areas in the Cascades could see 4 to 6 inches, with a small chance of up to a foot. Snow levels may drop to around 4,500 feet overnight, potentially impacting higher elevation travel.
articles.title: Snow Expected in Southern Oregon Mountains as Cold Front Arrives Sunday Night

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Douglas County Fair received six 2025 Achievement Awards from the Western Fairs Association, including two first-place honors. Awards recognized advertising, photography and promotional efforts. The 2026 fair is scheduled for Aug. 5–8 in Roseburg.
articles.title: Douglas County Fair Receives Six Western Fairs Association Awards

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Oregon CASA programs will receive $1.031 million in federal funding for FY2026 to support volunteers who advocate for children in foster care. Officials say the funding will help stabilize programs after 2025 budget challenges and expand support for children across the state.
articles.title: Federal Funding Approved for Oregon CASA Programs to Support Children in Foster Care

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Riverbend Live in Winston is seeking new volunteer leadership to continue beyond 2026. Organizers say the 30-year concert and youth drama program can continue with new volunteers, but without them the long-running community tradition may end after the 2026 season.
articles.title: Riverbend Live Seeks New Volunteer Leadership to Continue Beyond 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations on Feb. 4–5, including theft, parole violations, warrant arrests, and public order offenses. Incidents occurred across the city at parks, businesses, and public areas, according to the department’s daily activity logs.
articles.title: Police Log: February 4, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: February 5, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Forest Products is shifting specialty plywood production to its Coquille mill and reducing staffing by about 146 positions at its Riddle facility. The move supports expanded engineered wood operations and follows major investments to modernize mills and focus on core product lines.
articles.title: Roseburg Forest Products to Cut Jobs at Riddle Mill as Production Shifts to Support Engineered Wood Operations

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Detectives with the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team arrested 62-year-old William Pease late Feb. 3 in Myrtle Creek after locating nearly 98 grams of suspected methamphetamine and a concealed firearm in his vehicle. He was lodged in the Douglas County Jail on multiple drug and weapons charges.
articles.title: DINT Arrest: Man Jailed on Drug and Weapons Charges in Myrtle Creek

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: H.O.P.E. Drug Court graduate Elizabeth Weist-Gray is leading a two-day Food for Hope drive in Roseburg to support the FISH Food Pantry. The event runs Feb. 7–8 at Grocery Outlet and aims to replenish shelves after winter demand.
articles.title: Food for Hope Project Led by H.O.P.E. Drug Court Graduate Supports FISH Food Pantry

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations on Feb. 3–4, including assaults, theft, warrants, prohibited camping enforcement, and driving while suspended cases. Several individuals were lodged at Corrections following incidents across the city.
articles.title: Police Log: February 3, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Ingram Content Group is expanding its Roseburg distribution center with a new on-site printing facility, allowing millions more book titles to be produced locally and delivered faster to publishers, retailers, and libraries across the western U.S.
articles.title: Ingram Content Group Expands Roseburg Facility with New Printing Operations

articles.title: Roseburg's Hope Drug Court grads tackle hunger with community project
